title: @Meddler : Ardent Censer's stacking heal % complaints - Might I suggest a solution?
body:
The current issue people are having with Ardent Censer is that the % heal/shield bonus it and Mikael's is not unique, and it is additive rather than multiplicative. Supposedly this is because you want people to buy both Ardent Censer and Mikael's Crucible without a loss in efficiency. However, what really happens is that they just stack 5 Censers and a Deathcap or something like that. I have not done the math but apparently it's too much.

* Problem - Ardent Censer stacking is OP!
* Solution - Make Ardent Censer's +60 AP Unique!

Why does making Censer's AP unique help? Because then you only get +15% Heal/Shield Power, +10% CDR, and +50% Mana Regen for 2400g, not only making it lose a lot of individual efficiency, but the less AP you have the worse off your base heal/shield is so the % isn't working with nearly as much.

Is it a good idea? Who the fuck knows? I didn't do the math on this, either! Get the hell out of the Gameplay board, DTN!

https://i.gyazo.com/11cc575279f390dc3be71c361979ff53.gif

replies.body: We're not convinced yet that Ardent Censor stacking is a problem. It certainly could be, given you get up to some really large heal/shield values. Requires both a pretty squishy build and quite a lot of gold to get there though, so for now at least we're just monitoring how it goes. Have seen a number of non supports using Ardent Censor for the self healing boost, haven't seen anything yet that seems clearly out of line though (some really effective games with it, but that happens with other builds too of course, sometimes players do well).

Considering that before the buffs to Ardent Censer, it was a noob-trap item that could potentially lose your team the game for sinking your gold into it instead of a real item like say, Harbinger...  Players are probably just not used to Ardent Censer actually having a usable effect for the first time in the item's history, other than the 2 or 3 days people used it for buffed minions with Alistar.

Personally, I didn't even realize it was keeping the useless-as-shit Unique Passive and I had to re-read it thrice over in the shop until I figured out the Windspeaker's Passive was a non-unique effect listed as Stat Points.

This, a thousand times this. I finally feel like Soraka makes a difference again if you're careful; something she lost in her multitude of changes over the last few seasons. Having her itemization empower her heals late game makes a much smoother progression for her build path without having oppressive base values ruin everything.

Also note that you give up a lot of tank and AP potential with that many. I would suggest trying just an Ardent and Mikaels, and then stacking AP or whatever else your champion's heal scales on.

Dirty Soraka main here. When I played using only Heal and Clarity last year, I stacked AP only on my Soraka. The best healing I achieved was like... 700 per W. I can definitely say 3 ardents + a big ap item beats that by 100 hp. However doing that gives up raw power with my Q and E so it feels balanced.

OK, so with Natural Talent, full scaling AP runepage, and windspeakers blessing with 4 Ardent Censers, Swifties and a Rabadon's, on lvl 18 full build Soraka.

You would have 618.57 AP, +60% healing from additive Ardent, which would stack multiplitively with Windspeakers, another 10% heal increase.

Soraka heal ratio at max level is 200 (+ 60% AP).               (200 + .6) * 1.6 = 

320 + .96 AP

(320 + .96 AP) * 1.1 = 352 + 1.056 AP

352 + 1.056 AP = 1005.20992

1005 HP per W heal, which you will have 45% CDR for, so 1k heal every 1.1 second. Now if the person has runic armor (8% additional incoming healing) and a Spirit Visage (25% more incoming healing) it's even more.

((1005 * 1.08)*1.25) = 1357 additional incoming healing. So yea, I think it's safe to say that it might be a little broken...

If it was additive, then multiple ardent censers would be
100% base + 15% bonus + 15% bonus + 15% bonus = 145% total healing
If it was multiplicative, then multiple ardent censers would be
100% base x 1.15 bonus x 1.15 bonus x 1.15 bonus = 152% total healing
152% > 145%

I'm a little surprised that the passive was not unique.  It seems like rather clumsy game design.  Heals should scale primarily with AP, like other powers.  Not band-aid mechanics attached to a select few items.
It literally doesn't matter which part of the item you make unique. Either way you make stacking them inefficient.
